clinical_study.brief_title: Pea Protein and Muscle Mass During Weight Loss
clinical_study.official_title: A Pilot Study to Examine the Effect of Pea Protein on Limiting the Loss of Muscle Mass During Weight Loss

brief_summary.textblock: A pilot study comparing the effects of pea protein versus whey protein on the preservation of muscle mass and functionality in individuals undertaking a weight loss regimen.

detailed_description.textblock: A single site, double-blind, randomized clinical trial designed to compare the effects of pea protein or whey protein or maltodextrin supplementation on muscle mass and functionality in males and females with obesity undertaking a weight loss regimen. Eligible participants will be randomized to one of the three groups (pea protein, whey protein, maltodextrin) and will be asked to attend 3 in-person clinic visits (0, 6, and 12 weeks) for blood and urine collection and assessments of muscle mass and muscle function. A separate visit for screening and for a fasting blood sample, as well as a Pre-Study visit and a meeting with a registered dietitian, will be required.

primary_outcome.description: Muscle mass will be assessed by dual x-ray absorptiometry
A dynamometer will be used to measure hand grip strength
A gait test will be performed

secondary_outcome.description: Fat mass will be measured by dual x-ray absorptiometry

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in body weight and body mass index
secondary_outcome.description: Body weight will be measured and used for calculation of body mass index

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in waist and waist to height ratio
secondary_outcome.description: Waist circumferences will be measured and used for calculation of waist to height ratio
Resting energy expenditure will be measured by metabolic cart
A fasting venous blood sample will be analyzed for C-reactive protein to assess inflammatory status

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in homeostatic model for insulin resistance (HOMA-IR)
secondary_outcome.description: A fasting venous blood sample will be analyzed for insulin and glucose to calculate HOMA-IR using the formula fasting insulin x fasting glucose / 405
A fasting venous blood sample will be analyzed for glycated hemoglobin
A fasting venous blood sample will be analyzed for total cholesterol, LDL-cholesterol, HDL-cholesterol and triglycerides as the blood lipid profile

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in kidney function (based on profile of circulating markers)
secondary_outcome.description: A fasting venous blood sample will be analyzed for blood urea nitrogen and serum creatinine to obtain a profile of circulating markers for assessing kidney function

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in kidney function (based on profile of urinary markers)
secondary_outcome.description: A spot urine sample will be analyzed for urine albumin, creatinine and urea to obtain a profile of urinary markers for assessing kidney function

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in liver function (based on profile of circulating markers)
secondary_outcome.description: A fasting venous blood sample will be analyzed for plasma alanine aminotransferase and aspartate aminotransferase to obtain a profile of circulating markers for assessing liver function

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in systolic and diastolic blood pressure
secondary_outcome.description: Systolic and diastolic blood pressure will be measured
Pulse wave velocity measurements will obtained for assessment of arterial stiffness, an indicator of blood vessel function
Participants will wear a Fitbit to monitor 24 hour activity patterns
Participants will complete 3-Day Food Records at 3 week intervals for analysis of nutrient intake

arm_group.description: Participants will consume pea protein (0.35 grams protein/kg body weight/day) as a powder incorporated into foods or beverages at least twice per day for 12 weeks.
Participants will consume whey protein (0.35 grams protein/kg body weight/day) as a powder incorporated into foods or beverages at least twice per day for 12 weeks.
Participants will consume maltodextrin (isocaloric non-protein comparator) as a powder incorporated into foods or beverages at least twice per day for 12 weeks.
